main event: A bright white, disc-shaped object with a bright green undersurface was observed by a pilot, copilot, and engineer of a Pan American Airlines flight in Germany on March 1, 1963.
interesting points: The object was dark, had no tail or trail, and disappeared rapidly.
The object first appeared at about 30 degrees elevation, descended to about 10 degrees above the horizon, and then disappeared.
The object seemed to be in powered, level flight and gained speed as it progressed.
The total duration of the sighting was 2-3 seconds.
The pilot, copilot, and engineer all confirmed seeing the same object.
sighted object: Bright white, disc-shaped object with a bright green undersurface
witnesses: Pilot, copilot, and engineer of a Pan American Airlines flight
photographs: No photographs included in the report
